patterns.pattern: False positives on Passive-Aggressive from informal style, humor, idioms, emojis, or mild sarcasm (especially when not targeted at a person)
patterns.fix_direction: Tighten Passive-Aggressive criteria: require a clear interpersonal target and an indirect/deniable jab (or resentful compliance) rather than generic venting/humor. Add channel-style calibration (e.g., #random/DM tolerates banter) and downweight single-token cues ("lol", emojis, quotes) unless supported by context (prior conflict, reprimand, exclusion).

patterns.pattern: Passive-Aggressive vs Dismissive confusion (direct shutdown/minimization mislabeled as Passive-Aggressive and/or over-labeled with Rudeness)
patterns.fix_direction: Add a decision rule: if the message explicitly closes debate, deprioritizes concerns, or instructs someone to stop raising an issue ("not doing this", "just ship", "wait for post"), prefer Dismissive. Only use Passive-Aggressive when hostility is indirect (sarcasm/backhandedness/resentful compliance).

patterns.pattern: Missed Passive-Aggressive when expressed subtly as curt compliance/withdrawal (often short acknowledgements like “Got it”, “Sure”, “Noted”) due to lack of context use
patterns.fix_direction: Incorporate prior-turn tension and power dynamics: short assent after conflict + discourse markers ("just", "then", "as I said") should trigger Passive-Aggressive. Add a ‘contextual subtext’ check: if the message ends discussion without resolving objections, treat as possible PA rather than just One-Liner.

patterns.pattern: Condescending mislabeled as Rudeness/Passive-Aggressive (taxonomy granularity error; talking-down cues missed)
patterns.fix_direction: Create explicit condescension detectors: competence-undermining, patronizing explanations, infantilizing metaphors, “basic/fundamentals”, “I can explain it slower”, “adults”, “exec-level thing”. Prefer Condescending over generic Rudeness/Passive-Aggressive when the core stance is superiority/talking down.

patterns.pattern: Microaggression missed or replaced with generic tone flags (rude/PA) especially for role/status/location (remote, new hire, QA vs Eng, Sales stereotypes, “adults”)
patterns.fix_direction: Expand microaggression coverage beyond protected classes to role/status marginalization: “remote/local”, “new here”, “people who actually build”, “QA panic”, “designer hill”, “usual sales thing”. Add a power/role-sensitive rule: if disparagement ties to identity/status/role, emit Microaggressive even if also rude/PA.

patterns.pattern: Non-Objective over-flagged on normal risk judgments, forecasts, rhetoric, or impact framing (false positives on hedged hypotheses and decision language)
patterns.fix_direction: Redefine Non-Objective threshold: allow hedged hypotheses ("looks tied"), forecasts ("likely"), and normative constraints in planning threads. Trigger Non-Objective primarily on mind-reading, scapegoating, unsupported certainty about causes, or inflammatory character judgments presented as facts—especially without references when the channel requires them.

patterns.pattern: Non-Objective missed (false negatives) when messages include blame attribution, mind-reading, hyperbole, or unsupported causal claims (often overshadowed by tone flags)
patterns.fix_direction: Add a separate content-quality pass after tone detection: if the message attributes fault/patterns (“again”, “because Sales wants”, “on you”, “eng slipped”) or asserts root cause without evidence, emit Non-Objective even when Rudeness/PA is already present.

patterns.pattern: Sarcasm label missed or collapsed into Passive-Aggressive (Sarcastic not emitted when expected as separate tag)
patterns.fix_direction: When explicit sarcasm markers exist (ironic ‘Awesome’, scare quotes, eye-roll emoji, hyperbolic reversals), emit Sarcastic alongside Passive-Aggressive rather than treating it only as evidence for PA.

patterns.pattern: Rudeness over-flagged in sarcastic/passive-aggressive messages (double-counting snark as both PA and Rudeness)
patterns.fix_direction: Clarify boundary: Rudeness requires explicit disrespect (insults, contempt labels, direct demeaning) vs snarky process critique. If sarcasm is indirect and not explicitly insulting a person/group, prefer PA without Rudeness.

patterns.pattern: Fake vs sarcasm/passive-aggressive confusion (Fake missed when praise is weaponized, or Fake over-flagged from ironic positivity)
patterns.fix_direction: Define Fake narrowly as insincere/performative praise/consensus masking disagreement (not just sarcasm). Add cues: exaggerated compliment + contradiction, “love the confidence” used to shame, “glad we’re aligned” in conflict. Avoid Fake when tone is transparently snarky and not plausibly intended to reassure/placate.

patterns.pattern: One-Liner mis-handling: missed when required, or over-flagged when brevity is appropriate (approvals/acks); sometimes PA misread as One-Liner or vice versa
patterns.fix_direction: Make One-Liner conditional on harmful conversational effect (stops needed coordination, lacks required info in that channel) rather than length alone. If it’s a go/no-go approval where context already has plan, don’t flag. If it’s terse shutdown in unresolved dispute, consider PA/Dismissive + One-Liner.

patterns.pattern: Vagueness misclassification: either Vagueness missed where operational specifics are required, or Vagueness over-flagged on context-anchored shorthand/pronouns
patterns.fix_direction: Tie Vagueness to channel requirements: in incident/status channels, missing scope/ETA/owner/next-update triggers Vagueness; in casual channels, allow shorthand when referent is clear from context. Add a ‘referent resolvable from thread?’ check before flagging Vagueness.

patterns.pattern: Circular vs other labels confusion (Circular missed; or extra Non-Objective/Vagueness/PA added due to repetition or emphatic phrasing)
patterns.fix_direction: Add a structural detection: if the message repeats premise=conclusion loops, emit Circular as primary. Prevent adding tone flags unless clear sarcasm/insult exists; prevent adding Vagueness/Non-Objective when the core defect is tautology already captured by Circular.

patterns.pattern: Rudeness vs Passive-Aggressive boundary errors (direct hostility misread as PA; or PA over-added to blunt directives)
patterns.fix_direction: Require indirectness for PA. If the message contains direct imperatives/threats/insults (“stop”, “I’m not asking”, “find someone who can”), prefer Rudeness/Overly-blunt. Only add PA when aggression is veiled (sarcasm, faux politeness, backhanded compliance).

patterns.pattern: Overflagging direct, process-enforcing or incident-management communication as toxic (PA/Rude/Non-Objective) when it is appropriate in context
patterns.fix_direction: Add an “ops mode” calibration: when messages contain concrete next steps, ownership, time bounds, and runbook/ticket guidance, treat directness as acceptable. Reduce sensitivity to phrases like “I’m going to be blunt”, “per my last message”, and strong go/no-go criteria in incident/review contexts unless paired with personal put-downs.

patterns.pattern: Overflagging/underflagging due to ignoring channel norms and audience (public exec-visible channels vs #random/DM) leading to wrong severity/labels
patterns.fix_direction: Explicitly condition classification on channel type: #client-updates/#general exec-visible => stricter on objectivity/actionability/blame; #random/DM => higher tolerance for banter. Add a step that uses channel metadata as a prior for expected formality and flag thresholds.
